Please answer my code questions using the given API following this format: <<<api>>>: $API
<<<code>>>: $CODE

Question: WeakHashMap and WeakReference: :How to clear the key and value of instanceMap automatically; when the Conf object returned by getInstance() API is Garbage Collected using WeakHashMap and WeakReference ...?//single conference instance per ConferenceIDclass Conf {    private static HashMap<String, Conf> instanceMap = new HashMap<String, Conf>;    /*     * Below code will avoid two threads are requesting      * to create conference with same confID.     */    public static Conf getInstance(String confID){        //This below synch will ensure singleTon created per confID        synchronized(Conf.Class) {              Conf conf = instanceMap.get(confID);           if(conf == null) {                 conf = new Conf();                 instanceMap.put(confID, conf);           }           return conf;        }             }}
Please using this api: Iterator.next.
Answer: To automatically clear the key and value of instanceMap when the Conf object returned by getInstance() API is garbage collected, you can use a WeakHashMap and WeakReference. 

<<<api>>>: 
```java
private static Map<String, WeakReference<Conf>> instanceMap = new WeakHashMap<>();
```

<<<code>>>: 
```java
public static Conf getInstance(String confID) {
    synchronized (Conf.class) {
        WeakReference<Conf> weakConf = instanceMap.get(confID);
        Conf conf = weakConf != null ? weakConf.get() : null;
        if (conf == null) {
            conf = new Conf();
            instanceMap.put(confID, new WeakReference<>(conf));
        }
        return conf;
    }
}
```

<<<explanation>>>: 
WeakHashMap stores references weakly. When the object is no longer in use, it can be garbage collected. WeakReference is used to hold a reference to an object and allow it to be garbage collected. In this case, we use WeakReference to hold a reference to the Conf object. This way, when the Conf object is garbage collected, its key and value in the WeakHashMap will also be automatically cleared.

Please note that the WeakHashMap does not guarantee that it will not hold onto the key and value indefinitely. It depends on the garbage collector's decision to collect the object. Therefore, it's not a perfect solution for your problem. But it can help to reduce memory leaks.
